alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Baltimore City; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 12:53PM EDT until May 27 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL...ANNE ARUNDEL...EASTERN HOWARD...SOUTHERN BALTIMORE AND NORTHEASTERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTIES AND BALTIMORE CITY... At 1253 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Reisterstown to near Historic Ellicott City to Upper Marlboro, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Baltimore, Columbia, Bowie, Severn, Annapolis, Pikesville, Crofton, Middle River, Cockeysville, Elkridge, Riviera Beach, Largo, Mayo, Naval Academy, Upper Marlboro, Baltimore-Washington Airport, Fort Smallwood State Park, Gibson Island, Sillery Bay and Millers Island. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for central, northern and north central Maryland. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern Maryland. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Anne Arundel; Baltimore City; Prince Georges
